item.title: Report E-2025050008
item.description:
Report E-2025050008

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-01
  • City: WEST COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 1, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon bladder of UN2922 was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents, neutralizing agent, and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted material was collected in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025050542
item.description:
Report X-2025050542

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-01
  • City: WEST COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO PD4 DOOR 112 FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. WENT TO AREA. RESPONDED TO PACKAGE USING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS. CONTAINERIZED PACKAGE AND CLEAN UP MATERIALS IN A SPILL TRAY AND RETURNED TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
